page.title: 11Tuesday Market
page.content: There was a variety of stalls with clothes and food predominating.Other stalls included jewelry,material,towels and shoes.Most of the stallholders lived towards the edge of a twenty mile radius,but a few came from further afield,such as Coleshill in Warwickshire and southend in Essex.All the stallholders came to Beaconsfield every week on market day and the majority have been coing since the market first started,approximately three years ago.In addition to having a stall at beaconsfield every stallholder attended other markets.Again these were widely spread,ranging from local markets,such as High Wycombe,to markets at Leamington Spa and Alton.Generally,the stallholders were reasonably satisfied with the available failities.
